claims.claim: The observation data suggests that TRAPPIST-1 b has an atmosphere, as atmosphere-bearing models better explain the combined data products than a bare-rock model.

evidence.quote: Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere) | 7.4
Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products

claims.caveat: This is a single-planet study and does not establish atmospheric prevalence across all M-dwarf rocky planets.

claims.claim: The atmosphere of TRAPPIST-1 b likely contains carbon dioxide, as evidenced by spectral absorption features near 15 um.

evidence.quote: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate | 96 ppm
Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption

claims.caveat: O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data.

claims.claim: Energy is redistributed from the dayside to the nightside of the planet, suggesting atmospheric circulation.
claims.caveat: Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.

claims.claim: The planet has a low Bond albedo, meaning it is very dark and absorbs most of the light that hits it.

evidence.quote: Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits

claims.caveat: Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, cloud treatment) affect quantitative posteriors.
